headline: Cream of Asparagus and Mushroom Soup
description: The savory flavors of mushrooms and bacon make this cream of asparagus soup a warm starter course for a meal.
name: Cream of Asparagus and Mushroom Soup
recipeIngredient: 1 pound fresh asparagus, tips set aside and stalks chopped
salt and ground black pepper to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Place the bacon in a large, deep skillet, and cook over medium-high heat, turning occasionally, until evenly browned, about 10 minutes. Drain the bacon slices on a paper towel-lined plate. Crumble bacon when cool; set aside. Reserve 1 tablespoon of bacon drippings.
Melt butter with drippings in a saucepan over medium heat.
Cook and stir celery and onion in the saucepan until onion is translucent, about 4 minutes.
Whisk flour into the mixture and cook for 1 minute.
Whisk in chicken broth and bring to a boil.
Add potato and chopped asparagus stalks, reserving the asparagus tips for later. Season with salt and ground black pepper.
Reduce heat and simmer for 20 minutes.

Pour the soup into a blender, filling the pitcher no more than halfway full. Hold down the lid of the blender with a folded kitchen towel, and carefully start the blender, using a few quick pulses to get the soup moving before leaving it on to puree. Puree in batches until smooth and pour into a clean pot. Alternately, you can use a stick blender and puree the soup right in the cooking pot.
Cook and stir mushrooms and asparagus tips in the same skillet used for bacon until mushrooms give up their liquid, 5 to 8 minutes. Season with salt and ground black pepper, if needed.
Stir mushrooms, asparagus tips, and half-and-half cream to pureed soup. Cook until thoroughly heated.

review.reviewBody: Loved the recipe. I added the tarragon suggested in another review and loved it. I skipped the flour, didn't need it. Substituted vege broth for chicken broth to keep it vegetarian. I grilled the asparagus before cooking it, it added a little more taste to the garnish. Loved the mushrooms also. This is a keeper!
Prep time takes an additional 30+ minutes if you consider the peeling, slicing and dicing, measuring and blending. But it’s worth it. Creamy, flavorful, love it.
Restaurant quality. DELICIOUS!!! I've made it twice now. I added an extra potato and 2 packages mushrooms, I just love this soup!!

Absolutely delicious! Followed the recipe exactly, but had to substitute potatoes with sweet potatoes. Adding the bacon bits was perfect. I did add some garlic powder after I finished as I like garlic a lot. Next time I’ll cook the onions and celery with it.
Wonderful flavor. It took longer to cook but worth the few extra minutes. I will definitely make this again.
Great soup. Only thing i did differently from the recipe was not putting bacon. I didn't have that. To be made again.
It may not be the healthiest soup I’ve ever made, but it’s certainly one of the tastiest!

Outstanding and restaurant quality! However, I agreed with one other reviewer that additional flavoring was needed to kick this into a real "5". I looked up herbs that go well with asparagus and one of those was tarragon, so I put about 2 tsp. of that herb (dried) into the soup about 10 minutes before serving. That was it! I also discovered my mushrooms to be less than fresh, so I had to omit those, but in all honesty, the soup doesn't absolutely need those, so you choose. Keeping this in my "Soup" file on this site and WILL make again.

Great recipe! I used one zucchini in place of the mushrooms. It greatly improved the color!!! I subbed onion powder for the onion. I'm not a huge onion fan. Will be making this again. Would be beautiful with a chopped red pepper garnish for Christmas.
nice recipe, although I modified it to be GF and Dairy free.

Wanted to use up some extra asparagus before it went bad so we tried this recipe. It was Delicious! Made it exactly like the recipe, except I did not have any mushrooms. Still the soup was excellent! I think that the mushrooms would have even made it better. We will definitely make this again.

This soup is absolutely phenomenal! I used my own chicken bone broth, and since it would be pureed anyway, I tossed the asparagus (minus tips) and the potato into the food processor and finely chopped before adding them to the broth mixture. It made it easier to puree the soup later with my submersion blender. Since there were only two of us tonight, I finished up to adding the half & half, then cooled slightly and froze half before adding about half a cup of half & half to the soup in the pot. (I added a a note to the freezer container to add half & half when I serve the 2nd half.) Great recipe! The potato adds a wonderful earthiness to the flavor and mushrooms make everything better! I will definitely be adding this to my holiday menu.
I followed the recipe as shown. It was delicious! My husband loved it. I will be making this again. I served it with spicy corn muffins. Great combination.

LOVE IT ! 
Next time I'm going to put more mushrooms in it. Thats just me though. 

Thank you so much for the recipe
outstanding !!
Quick, easy and absolutely delicious! I made the recipe as-is, shared with 2 other families and everyone loved it. I will definitely make this again.

This was fabulous!! First off I had bacon already made so didn’t have drippings to cook in. Instead, I just added a little extra bacon in with the blended ingredients. I was short on broth so used 4cups chicken broth and 1 cup veg broth. Also used 1% milk instead of cream. Turned out restaurant worthy. Will definitely be making this again!!
DANGER, Tasted great but pouring the hot soup into my blender caused it to crack in 2 places.

Great recipe. I did make changes because I can’t eat onions & garlic and I didn’t have any Celery or bacon.
So I replaced the onions with sweet red peppers and the bacon with breakfast sausage. It was a delicious soup!
Made it to the recipe, with the exception that we used heavier cream (35%) more bacon never hurts either :)
I added some sliced carrots for colour and use cream, its great!

Husband liked it. Will definitely make again.
Can’t wait to try some others on your site!
Super easy. Super delicious.

This soup is great! I have made it twice. Left out the bacon the second time, but still used bacon grease. It was still great even without the bacon. I cooked the onions and mushrooms much longer than suggested and seasoned to taste.
This is a wonderful tasty soup

As a vegetarian, I made some tweaks to this soup and it was still super delicious. Both my hubby and our seven year old daughter came back for seconds. I clearly omitted the bacon and bacon drippings, and instead used an extra tablespoon of butter. I also replaced the chicken stock with veggie broth. This is a great, flavorful and hearty soup that was so satisfying on a winter night! Made grilled cheese to go along with it and it was the perfect meal.

Fabulous soup! My husband and I loved it so I will make it again. A satisfying dinner with a French Banquet and good Irish butter. I added a quarter of Cream cheese to the pot and my husband added a splash of Truffle oil to his bowl.
Absolutely delicious. It exceeded my expectations!
Very good!! I will make this again for sure!
I did not have celery or bacon but I had bacon grease. I did add jalapeno jack cheese. It came out very good, my first time. I would recommend this recipe.
Great recipe. 3rd time making it. We pick lots of wild Asparagus and make multiple batches for freezing in gallon storage bags for those cold winter nights.
This soup is wonderfully tasty and hearty. I used vegetable broth and lactose-free milk and it was still thick and creamy. This is definitely a keeper for our menus.
Delicious even without the cream.
Very good! I added one more potato and a few sprinkles of red pepper .
It was awesome even without the bacon....substituted some white wine. It became one of my winter staples!!!!

I love the soup! I’ll be making it again today because I have all the ingredients, the time, and two roommates who love it as much as I do! I discovered this soup several years ago, and this recipe has taught me the concept of quality soup making. Thank you for the recipe and, especially, thank you for the technique that can be applied to so many soups. I often substitute spinach for the asparagus, or I will add both, or a variety of vegetables. This soup is packed with goodness!

Great, super tasty. The adjustments I'd make a second time, not cook bacon for 10 minutes - I burnt it. I'll dice the heads of the asparagus and possibly small bites for the mushrooms too. I'll also serve with soft bread for dipping.

Turned out really tasty and wasn't to much work either. Had everything at home for enjoyable dinner. Couple of changes are added carrots to the celery and onion and using cream cheese instead of the sour cream. Topped it off with some home-made croutons.
Best soup recipe out there! The only thing I change (since the hubby doesn’t like the mushroom texture), I blend the mushrooms with the rest of the soup. Sooooo good!
I made this last night and it was OMG. I brought some to my boss who owns a Greek restaurant, and he wants to put it on his menu. Best soup I've ever had or made.

this was so good but I'm still trying to find the flavor of one I had in the restaurant in Cedar Rapids Iowa. I think I'll saute a few more mushrooms and blend them with the. Soup. I like more stuff in my soup so I will probably add half again as much of the mushrooms and asparagus tips has called for at the end of the recipe. Flavor was terrific and I certainly will make it again.
This soup was absolutely fabulous! I made it just as written except without the mushrooms, as my picky son doesn't like them. Didn't matter, still so wonderful. Thank you for this awesome recipe!
perfect!
Delicious recipe! I used skim milk and didn't puree any of it as we prefer a chunky type of soup. My husband loved it and I'll definitely be making this one again!
It turn out really good. Everyone liked it so much
Excellent! Followed recipe exactly as submitted except used whole milk instead of half & half as that is what I had. This is a keeper. Thank you.

I feel guilty about not raving on this site about this recipe before... God knows I've sent it to enough friends. I did use crimini mushrooms (about 12 oz) and cut the slices into a rough chop after sweating. Also added a pinch or two of cayenne.
A wonderful recipe!
We love this soup. My wife can’t go by asparagus without buying some when they are on sale. Just follow the recipe and you’ll love it too. All my guests who tasted this soup wants seconds.
Easy and tasty. I think it could use even more asparagus.
Best soup I have ever made..absolutely delicious!!!!

Highly recommend this one. I'm a soup snob. This was excellent! I always tweak my recipes, can't seem to stick to exactly what the recipe says. That's the art of cooking in my opinion, to make it my own. But really, this was pretty much spot on. Toward the end, I had fun sampling tastes in little dishes. One with a bit of Worcestershire sauce. Wow! Then another small sample of soup with a few drops of Braggs amino acids. Wowzers! Deelish! Everyone loved it and wanted the recipe. I will forward this to them with my adjustments. (Note: Boil the chopped potatoes & asparagus in 3 cups of water until soft. Use a potato masher instead of blender. E.A.S.Y! Then simply add all of it to the pot of soup.) Voilá (Also, this is my very 1st recipe review online ever!)

I made it, didn't change a thing and for Christmas will be making it again. Love soups, but this is a step above. Can't wait to serve it to my friends. It's easy to convert to gluten free for all my guests to enjoy.

I made this to use up some asparagus and mushrooms that had been sitting in the fridge for longer than they should. The soup still tasted great. I followed the steps pretty much as given but played fast and loose with amounts on most of the ingredients.
Delicious! Will definitely make this soup again!
Very tasty, satisfying soup! I will definitely make this again.

This is pure ambrosia! I made one change, and only because we made a mistake in shopping...I only had four cups of chicken stock, and the second box was beef stock, so I used 2 cups of the beef. This is the best soup ever. Years ago, in a snooty French restaurant, my husband had cream of asparagus soup, and he bragged about it all the time. I used this recipe to quell his need for it...and he swore it's better than what he got in the restaurant. I also upped the half-and-half by a quarter cup, using 1 full cup. Next time, I'm going to blend the bacon into the soup as well as having some for garnishing. The flavors were spectacular, and I'm already planning a huge batch so I'll be able to can some for this winter while asparagus is still easily available. My most sincere compliments to the home chef who created this recipe!

Subsequent batch: I boo-booed. I got distracted and put in *way* too much chicken broth. 2 full quarts instead of 6 cups. I know I'm not going to be the only one to do this. I fixed it by adding a second medium potato, and using cream instead of half and half. The resulting soup was still heavenly, subtle and delicious. The thickness of the cream made up for the extra broth, as did the extra potato, all without noticeably compromising the taste or texture. This stuff's just perfect.
So delicious! So easy! My family loved this recipe!

I had made pickled asparagus and had loads of spears left. Looking for a way to use them up.I did not have celery, cost very high right now. I added about 1/4 tsp of celery salt. I used low sodium stock so it really did not increase the saltyness. I also left out the flour. This makes a large pot so the neighbours are also enjoying this. Will make again.
I added 1 bay leaf while simmering, being sure to remove it before blending. Otherwise I followed the recipe exactly. Soup was DELICIOUS!!! Definitely will make again.

This is is AMAZING! My husband said, "it's the best soup I've ever had!" I almost doubled the recipe but decided against it since I had never had asparagus soup before. My son loved it and he hates asparagus lol! I followed recipe to a T, it was delicious. My husband bought an extra bunch of asparagus so I will be making this again in a couple days. Like I said folks this is delicious and even for those of you out there that don't like asparagus just try it I'm telling you you will absolutely love it!!
It was absolutely delicious. I didn't change the recipe but this was the first time I made it . Who knows, I might tweak it the next time!!
This is a definite keeper and I will be making it again and again. Thanks for the recipe.

This was the perfect mix of ingredients. I didn't puree the soup when making it the first time, however every other instruction was followed. I tend to have a strong preference for chunkier soups. I wouldn't mind trying to puree more of the soup next time. Regardless, the flavor, though, was absolutely wonderful. There isn't a single thing that I would change. I suspect that you could remove the bacon and bacon drippings if you so desired.

Thanks for this recipe! I haven't tried it yet, however, I know I'll like it. I'm a big fan of Shakey's creamy mushroom soup, and I want to know how to make it. Though this is not Shakey's thick mushroom soup, I will like this, maybe love it, even.

I made this exactly as directed. It was easy and we enjoyed it. I am giving only four stars just because I think it could have done with just a little herbal seasoning to liven it up a bit. Next time I will make a small bundle of herbs (like rosemary and a bay leaf) and remove them before pureeing the soup. I will also double the mushrooms next time because we love mushrooms. A splash of sherry might have also been nice.
I didn't have bacon but did have some bacon grease, so I used that. I had some asparagus I needed to use, so I found this recipe. It really is delicious! Thank you for sharing!!

I added some garlic when cooking the celery and onions and then a bit of curry powder. I didn't think it had enough mushrooms so added more of those. Delicious. I was using up asparagus I had on hand and was doubtful that my husband would like it. He loved it and told me I really should open up my own soup shop as he always likes my soups.
Wonderful. Will make again. Used precooked crumbled bacon, will leave out next time as don't think it needed it.
Great! I added a little extra potato and played with the spices a little but other than that I stayed true to the recipe and it was excellent!
This was a delightful soup. The ingredients seemed to go together in a new way for me, and I was concerned, but it turned out beautifully and in retrospect was not difficult to make at all.
This was so good! This recipe makes a lot so I thought it would last for several meals, nope! We all loved it, it was gone in two days
The only changes I made were to add garlic and thick green onion when sautéing the mushrooms and I did not purée the soup; I like chunks. My family raved.
I added a little extra bacon, and a little extra flour to make a little thicker, but this soup is really delicious! I tested it and liked it so much that I served it at our family Thanksgiving meal!

OMG! So good! I made it exactly as written except I used more bacon (of course!) I also added spices during the simmering time (whatever suits your taste) and some minced garlic to the mushroom mixture. EVERYONE had seconds and my 11 year old daughter had 3 bowls! You must try this one.

Lovely soup. Made as written except I'm vegetarian so added a dash of smoked paprika on serving , instead of the bacon. I would never have thought of adding mushrooms to asparagus soup, but thank you, Kristy!

I made this soup for company they last weekend. It was a hit. We all loved it. I used shiitake mushrooms and used 1% milk for less fat. It worked out great. 
SusieQ

I've made this soup several times. You can leave out the mushrooms and it's still good, but it's better with the mushrooms. They need to be fresh as well. This is a crowd pleaser and I make it with asparagus that is a bit old so it saves money! I also like to serve it with sourdough rolls and salad.

Really didn't like the flavor. Followed the directions exactly and very planty nasty aftertaste and smell. I could not taste the onion or anything except asparagus. I put almost a whole block of medium cheddar cheese into the soup to make it edible. The Cheese flavor covered the nasty aftertaste.
We added carrots to the recipe and it turned out amazing! Thanks much for the recipe.
Definitely on my Favorites list. Thank you, Kristy
Great flavor and very simple. I might add a bit more potato next time for a little thicker texture. Just personal preference, thought.

I'm a vegetarian so I made a few changes. Used vegetable broth instead of chicken, and sautéed the onion and celery in olive oil. I prefer more of a chowder so I used a stick blender and blended a few times leaving the soup a little chunky. I added sliced carrots, extra mushrooms and 1/2C frozen corn. Served with a warm spinach salad. Cooked bacon crumbles on the side for the meat eater in the family. Healthy, hearty and delicious!
Double the bacon. Super good.
It takes some work, but it was worth the effort because everybody loved it. Made it as directed, excellent!

I changed the chicken broth and mushroom parts up a bit. I used 3 x 14.5 ounces instead of a full 6 cups of broth. And when I added potato and asparagus bits to simmer I added dried king boletes and shaggy Maine mushrooms. I cut the last bit of raw store bought mushroom into small slices and used only a quarter of what this recipe called for. (The dried mushrooms made up for it) this recipe is freaking awesome. Thanks.
Delicious! I used baby bella mushrooms for additional flavor. Used olive oil instead of bacon drippings to saute vegetables, plain soy milk instead of half and half.

I followed the recipe exactly and this soup knocks it out of the park with great flavor and elegance. The only change I would make is to add more asparagus and maybe potatoes at the end to give it more texture. (Just a personal preference.)

What a great soup and I love the fact that in the end you still have bits of Asparagus not pureed. It was also a nice touch having the bacon pieces on top. I did have to make one small sub but I don't think it changed it much. I only had 5 cups of chicken broth so I did use 1 cup of vegetable broth. The only reason I gave it a 4 was that I have had another Asparagus soup from this site that was better, but please try this one.

This is a delicious soup, one of my favourites. I substituted sweet potato for the potato, and this added sweetness. I also used more asparagus than the suggested amount, which thickened it a bit more. Other than that, I followed the recipe.

This was amazing, by far the best soup I have ever made and I am a big soup maker! My husband even loved it and claims he doesn't like soup! Only thing was I added more mushrooms because I love them and added a little garlic salt. Yummy!

Just made this Christmas Eve for Christmas lunch tomorrow and had to have a cup to taste test before serving my guests. Very good soup overall, and adding the bacon drippings adds a smoky flavor to the bottom of the flavor profile, and the contrasting texture of the asparagus tips, which I blanched in salted water, along with the sauteed mushrooms, which I drained, made the soup almost a one cup meal given the protein value of the mushrooms. The crumbled bacon on top made this extra decadent, and tomorrow I plan on making some homemade croutons from a stale baguette, which will give it even more crunch. The only thing I added was some fresh squeezed lemon juice, and some worcestershire sauce to give the soup and overall more complex flavor. The asparagus was a much more subtle taste, than a traditional asparagus soup, where you primarily taste just asparagus and onion or asparagus and leek. This soup has it all. Thanks for sharing your recipe!

Like most of us non-purists...I like to modify recipes to reflect personal preferences and on hand stuff. I'm also not cutting the stars down because I did. So, personally, I started by skipping the bacon...didn't want that texture in a creamy soup. Instead, I used previously reserved refrigerated bacon fat. Another recipe suggested a diced Jalapeno, which I added to the mushrooms, celery and onions plus a few cloves of Garlic and my homemade Seasoning Salt. I used the fresh Turkey Stock made from Thanksgiving detritus...though chicken would be better probably, Plus I don't peel the spuds. I used unsalted butter because like the Stock...it's what I had. The blending was a lot easier w/ a stick blender. Also less salty considering it's MY stock recipe, unsalted butter and my own Seasoning Salt. BTW...The soup is great w/ tremendous flavor. My guest loved it and I'm counting on it freezing well.
Amazing!
A but bland for my taste. I added some extra pepper to give it a bit of a kick and this helped somewhat. Not a bad recipie!

Thanks for the awesome recipe - This one's going in my recipe box for sure! Made soup to use up abundant asparagus from garden. Going to freeze it for a cold winter day. Tasted so yummy, would like to say I can't wait for winter to eat it but, can't bring myself to say such silliness.
Fantastic soup!

Dinner guests last week and wanted an easy delicious soup as a start to my meal...this soup was exactly what I needed...so delicious and flavorful. Did not change a thing. We real keeper. Thank you so much.
I just made this soup it's awesome, made it exactly according to recipe, I am going to make this more often!

This is awesome! I used portabello mushrooms and added more than it called for as well as more asparagus. I did not have half and half and used skim milk, it tasted great! The bacon gives it that savory, delicious taste it needs. Thank you for such a yummy soup for a cold day!

item.name: Cream of Asparagus and Mushroom Soup
